name: Ten General Knowledge Questions Multiple Choice Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which singer had hits with 'Maggie May' and 'Do Ya Think I'm Sexy'?
questions.explanation:
Rod Stewart.

	He also sang 'Sailing', one of the Guinness Book of Records all time top 40 songs.

questions.text: Which plane was blown up over Lockerbie, Scotland?
questions.explanation:
Flight 103.

	Pan Am flight 103 was blown up on 21 December 1988. The trial of the alleged Libyan bombers is still taking place.

questions.text: Who plays Jessica Fletcher in 'Murder, She Wrote'?
questions.explanation:
Angela Lansbury & Angela & Lansbury.

	Angela Lansbury was born in Great Britain where her father, George Lansbury, became a government minister.

questions.text: Who said of George W. Bush, 'George is no dummy. He is a smart guy'?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Bush.

	Well, she is his mother....

questions.text: What relationship does Bridget Fonda have with Jane Fonda?
questions.explanation:
Niece.

	Bridget Fonda is daughter of Peter Fonda, niece of Jane Fonda and grand-daughter of Henry.

questions.text: Which disease has been eradicated from SE Asia in the early 21st century?
questions.explanation:
Polio.

	The World Health Organisation has run a major vaccination campaign around the Pacific Rim.

questions.text: Which is the first ghost to appear in Dickens' 'A Christmas Carol'?
questions.explanation:
Jacob Marley.

	Jacob Marley was Scrooge's former business partner. He warns Scrooge of the Christmas ghosts to come.

questions.text: Who was the last governor of Hong Kong?
questions.explanation:
Chris Patten.

	Chris Patten, a former UK Conservative government minister, was the last governor. John Patten is a different ex MP. Prince Charles presided at the handover of Hong Kong. Martin Lee is a leading democratic campaigner in Hong Kong.

questions.text: Who was the first king of Israel?
questions.explanation:
Saul.

	Saul was the first king. He was the father of Jonathan and patron of David. David in turn was the father of Solomon.

questions.text: Who is the patron saint of Scotland?
questions.explanation:
St Andrew.

	St Andrew is one of the 12 disciples, so not actually Scottish. St Patrick became patron saint of Ireland. St James sounds Scottish but is patron saint of Spain.
